item.title: Credit Risk Modeling and Scorecard Example
item.description: Introduction Load the data Summary of data Clean Data Exploratory Data Analysis Feature Engineering Training Create Scorecard Conclusions Introduction Credit Risk modeling predicts whether a customer or applicant will default on their loan. These models include predictor variables that are categorical or numeric. Since one of the key outputs in the modeling process is a credit scorecard with discrete attributes to allocate scores, the variables need to be discretised including the numerical variables.
